intro: Lepidaploa davidsmithii, commonly known as David Smith's lepidaploa, is a rare and endemic plant species native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads and leaf structures. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves and produces small, yellowish to brownish flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments, often found in cloud forests. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
